author: samwilsn
content: Can we remove the bloom filter from the block header?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
It does not provide much value, since it is too small and most bits are set for blocks on mainnet.
And if we removed it, we could almost half the size of the header, from 584 bytes to 328 bytes

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
We should also get rid of it for the receipts, since no client is actually storing the bloom filter.
They are recomputed if the receipt is accessed.
During sync, we need to download ~500gb of data for the blooms for all transactions that are discarded and not stored by the node.
(We have to download them to verify the block though)

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
This is 500gb that the node that we sync from has to regenerate and our node will throw away anyway.
Even if we decide not to get rid of the blooms in the receipts, we should consider omitting them from all wire messages.
